data.KccAns: Suggested that farmer can register in  PM Kisan Samman Nidhi scheme via Akshaya or CSC centre. Documents needed- Aadhar number, Phone number, Bank account number, Land tax receipt 2018-2019 and ration card. After registeration submit details in krishi bhavan.

data.QueryText: Asked about doses of fertilizer for 10 years old Mangosteen
data.KccAns: Suggested to apply 1 Kg lime per plant per year at two weeks ahead of fertilizer application. Apply 75 Kg organic manure per plant per year.  Apply 2.1 Kg Urea, 4 Kg Rajphos and 5 Kg Potash per plant per year. 10 days gap should be given between organic manure and chemical fertilizer application.

data.QueryText: Asked about doses of fertilizer for 5 years old nutmeg plant
data.KccAns:
Suggested to apply lime @ 500g per plant at two weeks ahead of fertilizer application. Apply organic manure at 10 Kg per plant per year.
Apply 110g Urea, 250g Rajphos and 210g Potash per plant during April- june. Apply 110g Urea, 250g Rajphos and 210g Potash per plant during September-October.

data.QueryText: Asked management of dieback disease of nutmeg
data.KccAns: Recommended to prun the diseased twigs 2-3 inches below the affected portion. Paste the pruned twigs with Copper oxychloride 50 WP (10 gram/litre of water) followed by spraying of Copper oxychloride 50 WP (2 gram/litre of water) on infected nutmeg tree.

data.QueryText: Asked about management of bud rot disease in Arecanut
data.KccAns:
Suggested to remove and destroy dead palms. When the spindle leaf starts withering, remove and destroy all affected tissues of the spindle along with healthy tissues and apply Bordeaux paste and protect it by covering with a polythene cover or a mud pot.
Drench the spindle leaf base and the base of the other leaves with Metalaxyl + Mancozeb 80 WP (2 gram/litre of water) in 2 weeks interval especially during monsoon season. Root feed with Potassium phosphonate 50 SC @ 6ml in 100 ml of water.

data.QueryText: Asked about Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana (Premium to be paid for banana)
data.KccAns:
Suggested that Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana (PMFBY) scheme provide insurance coverage and financial support to the farmers in the event of failure of any of the notified crop as a result of natural calamities, pests and diseases.
Apply online through  CSC or Akshaya centre.
For 0.16 ha banana the premium for Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana is 1140  for an insured sum of 48000.

data.QueryText: Asked about query related to Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana
data.KccAns:
Suggested that Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana is a cental sector scheme that provide insurance coverage and financial support to the farmers in the event of failure of any of the notified crops as a result of natural calamities, pests and diseases. PMFBY can be enrolled  through CSCs or Akshaya centre. Documents required are phone number, Aadhaar number, land possession certificate, land right document, sowing certificate or self declaration of intent to sow the proposed crop, and the copy of Bank Pass Book. 
Start of enrolment of farmers for the season(as per crop calendar) is from 1st October. For more details contact Agriculture insurance company of India - 1800 425 7064.

data.QueryText: Asked about varieties of rubber
data.KccAns:
Suggested that

PB 260: Released from Prang Besar Estate, Malaysia. Parentage Tjir 1 x Gl 1A high yielding clone having good secondary characters.  On farm evaluation(1631 kg/ha/yr)

RRII 105: Released from Rubber Research Institute of India. Parentage Tjir 1 x Gl 1. Clone coming under Category I. Drought tolerant. Good branching with strong union. The highest yielding clone showing stability in yield. TPD On farm evaluation(2210 kg/ha/yr)

RRII 414: Released from Rubber Research Institute of India. Parentage RRII 105 X RRIC 100. Clone coming under Category 1. A high yielding clone with vigorous growth and early tappability. Wood yield in terms of bole volume is high. Incidence of pink disease and abnormal leaf fall are moderate while the clone is relatively tolerant to Corynespora

RRII 417: Released from Rubber Research Institute of India. Parentage RRII 105 x RRIC 100. Clone coming under Category I. A vigorous and high yielding clone with above average tolerance to wind. Quality of wood is good in terms of high density and better processability. Incidence of abnormal leaf fall is low to moderate. Moderately susceptible to Corynespora.

RRII 422: Released from Rubber Research Institute of India. Parentage RRII 105 X RRIC 100. Clone coming under Category I. A clone with vigorous growth and high yield. Incidence of Pink disease is low. Trees are slightly short in stature with high leaf retention in immature phase.

RRII 430: Released from Rubber Research Institute of India. Parentage RRII 105 x RRIC 100. Clone coming under Category I. A high yielding and drought tolerant clone. This clone is vigorous in growth leading to early tappability. Incidence of abnormal leaf fall, pink disease and Corynespora leaf disease are low.
Contact  RRII, phone, 0481 235 3311

data.QueryText: Asked about management of cashew stem and root borer
data.KccAns:
Recommended to mechanically remove various stages of pest (grubs and pupae) by carefully chiseling the bark in the infected trees.
Swab the chiseled area with Chlorpyrifos 20 EC (10 ml/litre of water) and drench Chlorpyriphos 20 EC (2 ml/litre of water) solution into the soil near the root zone to minimize reinfestation by the pest.
Swab the trunk region (up to 1 m height from the ground level) and exposed roots, with a suspension of coal tar and kerosene (1:2 ratio) or neem oil (50 ml/litre of water) twice a year during March - April and November-December as prophylatic measure.

data.QueryText: Asked about query related to PM KISAN samman nidhi scheme
data.KccAns:
Recommended to do land verification through AIMS (https://www.aims.kerala.gov.in/) portal from Akshaya center or CSC. Details needed: Aadhar number, account number, phone number, tax receipt of land. After verification, submit details in Krishi bhavan
For more details visit https: //keralaagriculture.gov.in/pmkisan-2/
  User manual -  https://keralaagriculture.gov.in/wp-content/uploads/2022/04/PMKISAN-LV.pdf

eKYC is MANDATORY for PMKISAN Registered Farmers. OTP Based eKYC is available on PMKISAN Portal.
Contact Akshaya centre or nearest CSC centres may be contacted for Biometric based eKYC.
Deadline of eKYC for all the PMKISAN beneficiaries has been extended till 31st July 2022.

data.QueryText: Asked about management of bud rot disease in coconut
data.KccAns:
Recommended to clean the crown before monsoon and apply Bordeaux paste. Cover the applied part with a mud pot inverted to avoid contact with water. Spray Bordeaux mixture (1%) on the crown of the neighbouring palms as a prophylatic measure.
Burn all diseased tissues removed from the palm. Pouring Mancozeb solution (5 gram /300 ml of water) coupled with placing of small perforated sachets (2 no) containing 3-4 gram Mancozeb 75 WP in the inner most leaf axils is found to be effective. 
As a prophylactic measure, formulations of biocontrol agents like Trichoderma harzianum and Pseudomonas flourescens can also be applied on the crown.

data.KccAns:

enroll PMFBY through CSC or Akshaya centre via. https://pmfby.gov.in/. Documents required are Aadhar card, phone number, bank pass book, land right document, land possession certificate, sowing certificate or self declaration of intent to sow the proposed crop.

data.QueryText: Asked about methods to induce flowering in mango tree
data.KccAns: Suggested to apply Paclobutrazol @ 5 gram/10 litre of water for non-bearing trees as soil drenching 60 cm away from tree trunk. It is done during first fortnight of September and will induce flowering and fruit set yield during off years. Irrigate the trees after the application.

data.QueryText: Asked about Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana
data.KccAns:
Suggested that Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana (PMFBY) scheme provide insurance coverage and financial support to the farmers in the event of failure of any of the notified crop as a result of natural calamities, pests and diseases.
Apply online through  CSC or Akshaya centre.
Essential documents required are 
1. Land Rights Documents- Record of Right (RoR) 
2. Land Possession Certificate (LPC)
3. Aadhar Card (updated)
4. Bank Passbook (First Page –having details of bank accounts)
Enrollment of rabi crops starts in Oct 1

data.QueryText: Asked about nutrient management in coconut
data.KccAns: Recommended to apply Organic manure @ 25 kg/plant  every year. Open the coconut basin and apply Lime @ 1 kg has to be applied in acid soils two weeks before of fertilizer application. The first split has to be applied in April-June. The dosage is 500 gram urea, 750 gram raj  phos, 1  kg Potash per palm respectively. The second dose has to apply in September-October and the dosage is 500 gram urea, 750 gram raj phos, 1kg Potash per palm respectively.

data.QueryText: Asked doses of fertilizer for coconut
data.KccAns: Suggested to apply Lime @ 1 kg soils two weeks ahead of fertilizer application.The first split has to be applied in April-June. the dosage is 1400g 18:9:18 fertilizer and 500g Potash per plant respectively.  The second dose has to be applied in September-October and the dosage is 1400g 18:9:18 fertilizer and 500g Potash per plant respectively. Apply Organic manure @ 25 kg/plant  every year.

data.QueryText: Asked about Nutrient management in mature Coconut
data.KccAns: Recommended to apply Organic manure @ 25 kg/plant  every year. Open the coconut basin and apply Lime @ 1 kg has to be applied in acid soils two weeks before of fertilizer application. The first split has to be applied in April-June. The dosage is 500 gram urea, 750 gram raj  phos, 1  kg Potash per palm respectively. The second dose has to apply in September-October and the dosage is 500 gram urea, 750 gram raj phos, 1 kg Potash per palm respectively. Apply 100 gram borax per palm after each fertilizer application

data.KccAns:

Documents required are phone number, Aadhar number, land tax receipt, ration card. After application submit documents in Krishi Bhavan.
